title: Daily reminder that there is a difference between trolling and "breaking the meta"
body: Some people think it's the same thing.

replies.body: When a somebody random does it, it's called Trolling. When a pro does it, its "breaking the meta".

> [{quoted}](name=VertexRose,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L9Z56Ho5,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2014-12-27T21:34:52.970+0000)
>
> When a somebody random does it, it's called Trolling. When a pro does it, its "breaking the meta".

Like, imagine someone picking Jungle TF like it was done recently. He would obviously be called a troll. Yet a competitive team can do it and it's fine.
The reason pros can do it is because they're not complete shit at the game so its alright to branch out.
As a Master Yi/Xin Zhao mid player, I must say, I'm riding a really, *really* fine line between the two every time I do that.
master Yi mid actually kinda works. Do you go E first?

Usually Q against shorter ranged enemies, and W against really, really long range enemies.

It's actually really funny, nobody respects Yi mid so they always blow their abilities trying to hit me, and it's almost always super telegraphed too. One misstep on their part and bam, Alpha Strike negated their ability and now I'm wailing away on them.

> [{quoted}](name=TehNACHO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L9Z56Ho5,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2014-12-27T21:28:59.150+0000)

Amen. I main Vi Mid, and I share your pain.

Yeah, they should have at least some sort of idea of why what they're doing would work. I saw a Vlad jungle once, he thought his sustain might be enough to jungle, and it wasn't. That's fine, assuming you try it outside of ranked first. On the other hand, the annie support going "I'm a mage support I'm taking farm" to try to get someone to dodge, that's extremely troll and there isn't even any question of whether it could work in a soloq team.

That Annie wouldn't work in *any* team. A support is a support, even if they're also a mage. I play AP Soraka. Does that mean I farm? No, it means I harass and start building AP as soon as my Sightstone and Coin are up. Do I ever hit full build? Of course not; but just being there still makes me a significant contributor to the team. Annie can do it even better, since a huge portion of her kit comes from an *AOE stun*. Even without gold, she's a huge factor in teamfights, especially against unskilled opponents who will stay clustered.

I agree some supports especially if they got a kill can snowball and carry harder then about any mid laner can by holding of sightstone and building ap and buying wards. Though if your not snowballing nothing pisses me of more then a lux/annie/fiddlesticks support who comes by and uses there abilities to clear the huge wave of farm the only farm that you've had the chance to get for the past 5 mins because of a lot of teamfighting and when this happens several times... I mean even when I smurfed with annie and played annie support and rush mejai's mobi boots and got several kills early I didn't take the cs unless it was to hold turrets and then these support players who you can tell don't support much by seeing how they lane come in and feed and then make the game harder by taking all the cs as well as feeding....
sometimes it is the same thing. sometimes its not. there are no absolutes.
I think it's about the intent behind it. Do you have something that works for you? Play it. Are you here to fuck around and harass me? GTFO.

Your "fun pick" is only fun for **you** while your teammates have one more thing to worry about/adapt to.

You're starting off the game by showing that you don't care about your team. No surprise their morale sucks.

There's no opinion here. Ranked, in any game, sport, or hobby is a measure of how well you do in a competitive environment. You can play obtuse and argue semantics all you want, but at the end of the day you know you're wrong.

All I'm seeing is someone who thinks he's entitled to a reward for competitive play without being a competitive player.

Would you be equally as angsty if you played pro football and didn't get a Super Bowl ring because you thought it would be fun to try playing football running backwards all season? I'd say not, and I'd say your team mates would be angry at you because you're willfully sabotaging your team- just like you're doing in League.

League is a team game, and by refusing to play competitively in the competitive side of it you are being as rude and egocentric as an afker or intentional feeder.

Edit: And please keep the implied personal insults coming, that's really proving your point.

Learn to adapt to people and get along with them. If your morale drops in solo queue because I'm playing something I'm highly effective at and am able to contribute to the team with simply because you're unused to it, you should not be playing a cooperative game.

Playing something unusual in Ranked doesn't mean I don't care about my team; it means that I care enough about winning to play something I'm good at instead of adhering to meta picks out of fear that people who can't adapt will be "demoralized" by my choice.

People need to get the idea of a "Meta" out of their heads. Just because a champion is played in LCS doesn't make it better then the champions that weren't. League is about play and counter play, I played back in the open beta, before the pros and any of the competition. Ashe mid was amazing, Ezreal top worked. People see the "best players in the world" do something and think they can emulate it to be a better player. This thinking needs to stop, get comfortable with a champion or 2-3, learn that champion and the match-ups, choose a lane, learn your outs. Almost any champion can be played in any lane in the game. The meta only exists because bad players need help to not be as bad. start innovating again, stop dropping queue if a team member picks a champion that wasn't in the last major tournament. Thread posts like the above are just another pro guide following baddie complaining about something they are ignorant about.
